    <div id="guide_header_title">
     <h1>
      <span class="guidetitle">
       Reading Fairy Tales &nbsp;
      </span>
     </h1>
    </div>
    <div class="guideattr" id="guideattr">
     <span id="lastupdate" class="lastupdate">
      Last Updated: Nov 21, 2016
     </span>
     <span class="guideurl">
      URL: http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/fairytales
     </span>

    <div id="content">
     <div id="contentleft" style="width:230px;">
      <div id="leftboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox21530725">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21530725">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21530725">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Need help with your research?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21530725">
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
           Contact:
          </p>
          <p>
           Kelly Cannon
           <br />
           Humanities &amp; Business Librarian
           <br />
           phone: x3602
           <br />
           email: kcannon@muhlenberg.edu
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt21530725" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox21530726">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21530726">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21530726">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Reference works
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21530726">
          <div id="boxatt21530726" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
             <li id="link25037814">
              The Book of Symbols
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Archetypal meaning of many cultural icons. Available in Trexler Library RESERVES.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019176">
              A Companion to the Fairy Tale
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Trexler Library RESERVES.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25037809">
              Dictionary of Symbolism
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Archetypal meaning of various cultural icons. Available in Trexler Library RESERVES.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019109">
              Oxford Companion to Fairy Tales
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Trexler Library RESERVES.
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox21553835">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21553835">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21553835">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           More books on reserve for FYS 139
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21553835">
          <div id="boxatt21553835" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
             <li id="link25041854">
              Breaking the Magic Spell
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. By Jack Zipes. Nice introduction the purpose and meaning of fairy tales. Deals with politics, history, fantasy, religion, and morals. Rats, wizards, fairies, ogres.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041815">
              A Companion to the Fairy Tale
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. Discusses the characteristics of the traditional fairy tale in Europe and North America.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041825">
              Don't Bet on the Prince
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Trexler Library Reserves. Essays collected and edited by Jack Zipes. Feminist criticism.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041832">
              The Fairy Tale as Art Form and Portrait of Man
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Trexler Library Reserves. Treats several tales and motifs.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041840">
              From the Forest
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Trexler Library Reserves. Connects fairy tales with the forest and nature.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041842">
              Grimm Legacies
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Trexler Library Reserves. By Jack Zipes. Treats varied tales and themes.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041845">
              Grimms' Bad Girls and Bold Boys
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Trexler Library Reserves. Focus on gender.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041863">
              The Hard Facts of Grimms' Fairy Tales
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. Shows the dark side of fairy tales. Many themes and tales are discussed. Sex, violence, victims, seekers, nags, witches, ogres, etc.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041859">
              The Irresistible Fairy Tale
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. Jack Zipes.  Varied tales and themes. Witches, women, death and regeneration, etc.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041865">
              Once Upon a Time
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. Themes: animals, beasts, brothers, children, witches, crones, dreams, fathers, mothers, etc.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041879">
              One Fairy Tale Too Many
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. Origin and development of the Grimm tales.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041847">
              The Uses of Enchantment
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. By Bruno Bettelheim. Classic study. Psychoanalytic. Treats several tales and themes.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041883">
              Ventures into Childland
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. Theme of adults and children, and growing up.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25041884">
              When Dreams Came True
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Location: Trexler Library Reserves. Jack Zipes. Cultural and historical development of the fairy tale generally.
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox21530727">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21530727">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21530727">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           How do I locate scholarly articles and books?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21530727">
          <div id="boxatt21530727" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
             <li id="link25019049">
              <a id="link_25019049" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=a9h" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25019049,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Reading Fairy Tales', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12343584}); ">
               Academic Search Complete
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Full text access to scholarly and non-scholarly publications in a wide variety of disciplines and subject areas.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019051">
              <a id="link_25019051" href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/advancedsearch" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25019051,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Reading Fairy Tales', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 18508793}); ">
               Encompass Search
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Encompass Search searches for books and other resources, first in our own library, and then beyond, in other research libraries.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019262">
              <a id="link_25019262" href="http://books.google.com" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25019262,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Reading Fairy Tales', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 18508825}); ">
               Google Books
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Google Books is a rich source of full-text documents (books and other materials) published prior to 1923 that are now in the public domain.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019047">
              <a id="link_25019047" href="http://scholar.google.com/" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25019047,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Reading Fairy Tales', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 19974037}); ">
               Google Scholar
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               May be used in conjunction with interlibrary loan. Access to full text is maximized by searching from the Muhlenberg network.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019180">
              <a id="link_25019180" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.jstor.org/" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25019180,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Reading Fairy Tales', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12717122}); ">
               JSTOR
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Full text of scholarly journals from most academic disciplines. Coverage is from the inception of the journal through three to five years ago. Current issues are often to be found in Project Muse (see below). Includes nearly 300 journals specific to language and literature, including American Literary History, American Quarterly, Chaucer Review, College Composition and Communication, College English, College Literature, Early American Literature, ELH, English Journal, New Literary History, Shakespeare Quarterly, Southern Literary Journal, and Yearbook of English Studies.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019048">
              <a id="link_25019048" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=web&amp;defaultdb=mzh" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25019048,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Reading Fairy Tales', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12766286}); ">
               MLA International Bibliography
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Premier scholarly index, with numerous links to full text, to criticism in the areas of literature, language, linguistics, film studies, and folklore, published from 1920-present.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019179">
              <a id="link_25019179" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=https://muse.jhu.edu/browse" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25019179,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Reading Fairy Tales', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12717121}); ">
               Project MUSE
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               A full-text database specializing in journals in the humanities. Often complements JSTOR with more current holdings. Full text journals include African American Review, American Literary History, American Literary Realism, American Literary Scholarship, American Literature, American Quarterly, American Speech, College Literature, Early American Literature, Eighteenth-Century Fiction, ELH, Journal of Narrative Theory, Modern Fiction Studies, Southern Literary Journal, Studies in American Fiction, and Studies in American Jewish Literature.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25019309">
              <a id="link_25019309" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=psyh" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25019309,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Reading Fairy Tales', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12326504}); ">
               PsycINFO
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Premier database of scholarly and professional journals and books in psychology and related areas.  Some full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise, use the Check for Full Text buttons to check for full text online or in the library.
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
      <div id="profile5713305" class="profile_wrapper">
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox21530729">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21530729">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21530729">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Citing sources
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21530729">
          <p>
           For tips on citing print and electronic sources, visit
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/research/citation-guides.html">
            Trexler Library's
            <em>
             Citation Guides for Print and Electronic Resources
            </em>
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           For automated citation, try the shareware
           <a href="http://www.zotero.org/">
            <em>
             Zotero
            </em>
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt21530729" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox21530730">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21530730">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21530730">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Articles via interlibrary loan
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21530730">
          <p>
           Journal articles not found in Trexler Library can be ordered on&nbsp;
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt21530730" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div id="footer">
     <div id="footer_topline">
